sen.j: 日本芸術院賞（にほんげいじゅついんしょう）は日本芸術院の賞。
sen.e: The Award of the Japan Art Academy refers to the awards presented by the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 戦前は帝国芸術院賞といった。
sen.e: Prior to the World War 2, it was referred to as the Imperial Arts Academy Award.

sen.cmt: 第二次世界大戦をWorld War II とした。

sen.j: 日本芸術院から、同会会員以外の者で、卓越した芸術作品を作成した者又は芸術の進歩に貢献したものに授される。
sen.e: The Japan Art Academy presents its award to the artists, who are not the members thereof, for their achievement in creating outstanding work of art or for their contribution to the advancement of arts.

sen.j: 同賞は1941年の第1回（受賞者 小磯良平）からほぼ毎年贈られている。
sen.e: This award has been presented to the winner or winners virtually every year since its inaugural presentation ceremony held in 1941 (won by Ryohei KOISO).

sen.j: 1951年からは受賞者が増えたこともあって、その中で特に選ばれたものに『恩賜賞 (日本芸術院)』が贈られるようになった。
sen.e: Since 1951, due in part to the increased number of winners, the Academy added the new award 'Onshi Sho' (Emperor's Prize) (Japan Art Academy) to present to the most outstanding among the winners.

sen.j: 受賞者の多くは、続けて日本芸術院会員に推されるが、中には推されるまで十年近くかかる人、推される前に亡くなる人、遂に推されずに終わる人などもいる。
sen.e: Subsequent to receiving the award, the winners often gain the nomination for enrollment to the Academy's membership but, in the case of one of the winners, nearly 10 years went by before the nomination was received while in the case of the other winner, the nomination finally came after that person had passed away and, still, for some of them, it never came.
